title: Harry Styles admits he turned down the role of Prince Eric in Little Mermaid remake

Former One Direction singer Harry Styles opened up about why he decided to turn down the role of Prince Eric in Disney's upcoming Little Mermaid retake.

Harry, 25, told Capital Breakfast that he met with the film’s director but didn’t take the role because of "a few things."

The 25-year-old singer was in talks with Disney over appearing in their live-action reimagining of the classic film.

After joking around that the former boyband member was trending as number one worldwide, the singer-turned-actor teased at the reason behind rejecting the Disney role in an interview with Roman Kemp and Sonny Jay.

(Image: PA)

Presenter Sonny questioned the star: "When The Little Mermaid was about, you were trending because you were playing the part of Eric, what happened?

"Did you turn it down? Did you even audition? What’s the deal?"

The singer, who rose to fame on The X Factor in 2010, revealed: "I had, you know, a meeting with Rob Marshall the director, who is the most wonderful man, he’s great.

"And it was just, honestly, it was just a few things. It just, it wasn’t...erm... I think it’s gonna be amazing, obviously it’s an amazing film, and I can tell Roman’s watching how I’m kind of worming."

"No mate!" Roman exclaimed. "It’s not… Harry it’s because…" as he urged him to answer.

However Harry simply replied: "How’s he gonna worm around this one?"

The trio laughed as the singer awkwardly failed and expertly avoided answering the question.

Harry has been looking to build on his acting debut in Christopher Nolan's Oscar-winning war film Dunkirk in 2017 but has reportedly failed to land a prominent role elsewhere.

(Image: Getty Images for The Recording A)

(Image: Getty Images)

He auditioned for the role of Elvis Presley in Baz Luhrmann's biopic of the singer but US actor Austin Butler got the part instead.

The Little Mermaid is making a comeback to cinemas in a new form entirely.

The 1989 iconic Disney classic is getting the live-action treatment, courtesy of Mary Poppins Returns director Rob Marshall .

Disney has already announced singer Halle Bailey has been cast as Ariel in the film, which is scheduled to go into production in early 2020.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

The Little Mermaid will feature songs from the 1989 animated classic by Alan Menken and Howard Ashman, as well as new songs by Menken and Lin-Manuel Miranda.

Disney's The Little Mermaid live-action remake does not currently have a release date.

It's the latest in a series of Disney live action remakes of 1990s animated favourites, including the Lion King and Aladdin .

Hear Harry Styles’ interview in full on Capital Breakfast with Roman Kemp this Thursday.
description: The Former One Direction singer addressed turning down playing the beloved character in Disney's upcoming live action remake
